basics.name: Lee Green
basics.label: Software architect, full-stack developer, team lead
basics.summary: Software architect and full-stack developer, experienced in building APIs and backend systems for web and mobile. Proven project and team leader with a history of leading both employees and consultants. Passionate about solving business problems with elegant software solutions. Adept at distilling clear technical specs from user requirements.

work.summary:
Maker of tools and online community for IT pros.
Initially hired as Senior and promoted at my first review.
highlights: Team Lead of the Infrastructure team, reporting to the CTO
Project Lead on many high-impact projects:
* Multiple Ruby and Rails upgrades
* Full HTTPS web app conversion
* Migration to AWS
* JRuby to MRI (C Ruby) port
* Creating a locally installable version of a cloud app
Optimized performance of flagship web application
Operated a weekly "lunch and learn" talk series
Created a biweekly backend developer meeting for information sharing and professional development
Created and taught courses on relational databases and Ruby for intern onboarding
Managed an intern for several summers, as well as a one-semester co-op

work.summary: Provide software architecture / development / optimization services
highlights: Designed and built (in Python) a stateful log parser to turn raw device logs into a rich event stream
Designed event data model to allow for flexible yet efficient queries
Built a pipeline to handle these events, including enrichment and delivery to internal/third-party consumers

work.summary:
Provider of technology and tools for data and intelligence gathering and visualization.
The company ceased operations not long after I came on board.
highlights: Designed and implemented features and bugfixes at all levels of the web stack
Improved critical-path performance 20% by optimizing PostgreSQL database indexes
Converted existing server-rendered features into a single-page architecture with Ember JS

work.summary:
Digital media and jukebox company headquartered in Montreal, Quebec.
I was the only Barfly engineer asked to relocate to Canada when the Austin office closed.
highlights: The go-to guy for quick solutions, rapid prototyping, and exploration of new tech:
* TouchTunes Presents – built the MVP on a tight deadline
* Crowd-Sourced DJ, SXSW party – allow attendees to choose the music
* Real-time Analytics – evaluate analytics providers before full instrumentation
Software architect and project lead for multiple 5-6 figure projects
* TouchTunesTV Canvas – completely customize in-venue messaging, pull content from Twitter
* PhotoBooth – customize app graphics on a per-jukebox basis, add venue logo
Software architect / lead developer for Barfly / TouchTunesTV digital signage system
Stepped in to lead the mobile / API team for 4 months, including on-time app launch
Advocated for improvements to the development process, including Git and Vagrant
Trained team members and coworkers; gave presentations promoting best practices

work.summary:
Digital signage startup focused on the out-of-home market: bars and restaurants.
Acquired by TouchTunes in September 2008. I was engineer #3 of 5.
highlights: Built our own digital signage system in six months, Features included:
* Dynamic data-driven media
* Remote automated system administration
* Intelligent scheduling and targeting
* Real-time log delivery and processing
Designed and implemented a self-hosted SMS application in Perl
Wore all the hats: client, server, databases, web apps, hardware

work.summary: Manual and automated testing of embeddable RDBMS and clients.
highlights: Improved testing framework and process
Automated previously manual stress test with Ant, Perl, and STAF

work.summary: Small software consulting shop. Worked on internal and client projects. I started working part-time while in school and continued full-time after graduation.
highlights: Built scripts, libraries, and applications in Perl, bash, C++ (STL)
Performed internet / market research and basic modeling
Ordered, set up and maintained a local Linux server
